column1: contemplates a continuing state of things; it is sufficient if the
lack  of  justification  appears  at  any  subsequent  point  of  time;
this  is  clear  from  paragraph  (b)  of  section  39A(2):  if  the  land
has  not  been  used  for  a  public  purpose  after  possession  has
been taken, there is then an insufficiency of justification; and
the  greater  the  lapse  of  time,  the  less  the  justification  for  the
